Event.name: Commercial_transaction
Event.definition:
<def-root>These are words that describe basic commercial transactions involving a <fen>Buyer</fen> and a <fen>Seller</fen> who exchange <fen>Money</fen> and <fen>Goods</fen>. The individual words vary in the frame element realization patterns. For example, the typical patterns for the verbs buy and sell are: BUYER buys GOODS from the SELLER for MONEY. SELLER sells GOODS to the BUYER for MONEY.
<ex><fex name="Buyer">His</fex> <fex name="Money">$20</fex> <t>transaction</t> <fex name="Seller">with Amazon.com</fex> <fex name="Goods">for a new TV</fex> had been very smooth.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Buyer
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen> wants the <fen>Goods</fen> and offers <fen>Money</fen> to a <fen>Seller</fen> in exchange for them.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goods
Arg.definition: <def-root>The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The means by which a commercial transaction occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Money
Arg.definition: <def-root>Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction. </def-root>

Arg.name: Rate
Arg.definition: <def-root>Price or payment per unit of Goods.</def-root>

Arg.name: Seller
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Unit
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Unit of measure of the Goods according to which the exchange value of the Goods (or services) is set. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: transaction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instance of buying or selling.
